I am a software engineer at DFINITY since 2021.

I completed my doctoral studies in Prof.~Peter~M√ºller's Programming Methodology Group at ETH~Zurich. My focus was on developing scalable and precise automated formal reasoning techniques and programmer-friendly tools for formal verification.

Before joining ETH, I worked at Intel as Research Scientist, developing tools for automatic power & performance debugging in mobile systems. I also worked on compilers, applying machine learning for automatically tuning compiler optimizations and designed novel optimizations for an explicitly parallel computer architecture.
I hold a MSc degree in Computer Science and a BSc degree in Applied Mathematics and Physics, both from MIPT, Russia.

children.name: Viper
text: I used to be a member of the team developing Viper, an intermediate language and the infrastructure for SMT-automated deductive formal verification. My focus was on extending Viper's specification features, enabling modular verification of heap reachability and comprehensions (data structure aggregations). Additionally, I used to be the maintainer of Viper~IDE.
